trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class is an exception that occurs when the server returns an `<errorResponse>`.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified response object.
The default message displayed to the client is "<errorResponse> returned".
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse"></xref> object returned by the server that corresponds to the `<errorResponse>`.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException.#ctor(System.String)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified message.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse,System.String)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified response object and message.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse"></xref> object returned by the server that corresponds to the `<errorResponse>`.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified serialization data and streaming context.
Data required to serialize the parameter.
The source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the parameter.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified message and inner exception.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.
The <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref>, if any, that threw the exception.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse,System.String,System.Exception)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException"></xref> class using the specified response object, message, and inner exception.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse"></xref> object returned by the server that corresponds to the `<errorResponse>`.
The message displayed to the client when the exception occurs.
The <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref>, if any, that threw the exception.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> method populates the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with the data required to serialize the parameter.
Data required to serialize the parameter.
The source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the parameter.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ErrorResponseException.Response"></xref> property contains the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse"></xref> object that corresponds to the `<errorResponse>`.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlErrorResponse"></xref> object that corresponds to the `<errorResponse>`.
